meanings.definition: A soft, wet sound made by liquid hitting a surface.
meanings.sent1: The splish of raindrops on the roof was soothing.
meanings.sent2: I heard a splish when the water droplets fell into the puddle.
meanings.sent3: The little girl giggled at the splish of the fountain in the park.
meanings.sent4: The splish of the waves against the shore was like a lullaby.
meanings.sent5: The splish of the paint as it dripped onto the canvas created a unique pattern.

meanings.sent1: I splish the water in the bathtub while taking a bath.
meanings.sent2: The kids love to splish in the pool during summer.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally made the soup splish all over the stove.
meanings.sent4: The rain continued to splish against the window throughout the night.
meanings.sent5: The dog's tail would splish against the water as he swam in the lake.

meanings.definition: A small amount of liquid that splashes.
meanings.sent1: There was a splish of milk on the table after the glass tipped over.
meanings.sent2: The toddler enjoyed playing with the splish of water in the sink.
meanings.sent3: The cat left a splish of water on the floor after drinking from its bowl.
meanings.sent4: The splish of juice from the squeezed orange was refreshing.
meanings.sent5: The splish of oil in the pan signaled that it was hot enough to cook.
